author: Special Correspondent
text:
Hard work will enable budding chartered accountants to achieve success and build a successful career, said M. Tirumala Kumar, Principal Commissioner of Income Tax.

He was speaking at the inaugural of the annual seminar of the Salem branch of the Southern India Regional Council of The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) held here on Saturday.

He said that the CA course has a great value and future and the country needed about 10 lakh chartered accountants.

R.S. Isabella, Executive Director, Repco Bank, P. R. Aruloli, Chairman, SIRC of ICAI, and A.V. Arun, Vice-Chairman of Salem branch of ICAI, offered felicitations.

A. Sowkath Ali, Chairman, Salem branch of the SIRC of ICAI, presided over the inaugural function.

In the technical sessions that followed, G. Naveen Khariwal from Bengaluru spoke on ‘Issues in assessment procedure under Income Tax’; E. Phalguna Kumar, Regional Council member of SIRC of ICAI, presented paper on ‘Issues in partnership firm taxation’; and Sripriya Kumar, Central Council member, ICAI, handled the session on ‘Companies Act 2013: accounts and audit’.
title: ‘CA course has great value’
